intro: Tetrapterys turnerae, commonly known as the Turner's tetrapterys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into five or more lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
